summary: This batch represents work across multiple product teams (GOC, TPT, MIO) focusing on OTP (One-Time Purchase) checkout implementation, pet food subscription features, and team infrastructure updates. Major themes include payment flow improvements, UI component development, experimentation setup, and technical debt resolution through bug fixes and test quarantine management.

decisions.what: De-scoped loading state improvements for OTP payment MVP
decisions.rationale: Not required for MVP launch despite OTP endpoint potentially taking 20+ seconds

decisions.what: Cancelled graduation component development for OTP dashboard
decisions.rationale: No longer needed as all users will get different acquisition vouchers, eliminating need for post-checkout experiment

decisions.what: Archived stale experiment and feature gate from New Dashboard initiative
decisions.rationale: Cleanup of stale configurations to improve system efficiency and reduce clutter (not modified in 2+ months)

decisions.what: Implement Charge at Checkout for pet food trial boxes
decisions.rationale: Reduce errors by charging users at checkout instead of cutoff, with subsequent boxes charged at cutoff

initiatives.name: OTP (One-Time Purchase) Checkout Implementation
initiatives.description: Building end-to-end checkout flow for one-time purchases including payment processing, order creation, event tracking, and analytics integration with Statsig

initiatives.name: OTP Product Roll-out
initiatives.description: Creating product families and products on live environment with proper menu configuration

initiatives.name: Pet Food RAF (Refer-a-Friend) Improvements
initiatives.description: Improving RAF program with new entry points via quick action cards

initiatives.name: Pet Food Zestification
initiatives.description: Updating UI components to comply with HelloFresh Zestification rules using Zest design system

initiatives.name: Pet Food Portion Mixing Feature
initiatives.description: Allowing users to mix pet food portions with other food, including dynamic plan card updates

initiatives.name: HFNL Plan Type Switcher
initiatives.description: Building plan type switching functionality for HelloFresh Netherlands with feature flagging

initiatives.name: MIO Team Infrastructure Setup
initiatives.description: Updating ownership details across repositories for newly formed Market Innovation & Optimization team

blockers.description: Helm Charts and Comply Files updates blocked pending HR and security updates to Workday and Azure group creation
blockers.impact: Cannot complete team ownership transfer for MIO team repositories

blockers.description: OTP endpoint may take 20+ seconds to confirm payment, but loading state improvements de-scoped
blockers.impact: Risk of customers closing page during long payment processing times

entities.name: GOC
entities.context: Team working on OTP checkout, delivery banner UI, and order confirmation features

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: Pet food team working on subscription features, RAF, charge at checkout, and portion mixing

entities.name: MIO
entities.context: Market Innovation & Optimization team, formerly New Ventures Systems, working on HFNL features and infrastructure

entities.name: Statsig
entities.context: Experimentation and feature flagging platform used for OTP events, dashboard experiments, and HFNL plan switcher

entities.name: Beatrice Dimarucut
entities.context: Product/decision maker for OTP features, made scoping decisions on graduation component and loading states

entities.name: Marina Guthmann
entities.context: Developer working on delivery banner UI revamp and graduation component

entities.name: Pamela Elisabeth Plúas Guerra
entities.context: Developer handling experiment archival and checkout success event tracking

entities.name: Oliver Strobel
entities.context: Developer working on charge at checkout feature for pet food

entities.name: Zest
entities.context: HelloFresh design system being adopted for UI component standardization

entities.name: Sentry
entities.context: Error tracking system reporting product SKU and request failure issues

entities.name: HFNL
entities.context: HelloFresh Netherlands market receiving plan type switcher feature

technical_patterns.pattern: Custom hook wrapping pattern for checkout-specific logic
technical_patterns.context: useCreateOTPOrderForCheckout wraps useOneTimePurchaseOrder data-access hook to encapsulate checkout-specific behavior

technical_patterns.pattern: Feature flag driven development with local storage overrides
technical_patterns.context: Statsig feature gates with local storage overrides enable production testing without customer exposure

technical_patterns.pattern: Test quarantine system for flaky tests
technical_patterns.context: Automated system to prevent flaky tests from blocking CI/CD, tracking 88% success rate for checkoutWithTrialBoxWithCutsSelection

technical_patterns.pattern: Event tracking integration in minimal handlers
technical_patterns.context: Modifying onCheckoutSuccessMinimal to support trackCheckoutSuccess sale events for analytics

technical_patterns.pattern: Component variant pattern for UI flexibility
technical_patterns.context: Graduation component designed with multiple variants (re-order default, graduate to subscription)

technical_patterns.pattern: Domain-Driven Design investigation for business logic centralization
technical_patterns.context: Spike work to centralize Products/ProductFamilies/Plans domain logic through DDD approach

technical_patterns.pattern: Helm Charts and Comply Files for team ownership
technical_patterns.context: Infrastructure-as-code approach to managing team ownership and compliance across repositories

work_themes: OTP checkout implementation and payment flow
UI/UX improvements and design system adoption
Technical debt resolution and bug fixes

dependencies.context: Joint QA task to checkout with new OTP endpoint and analyze Statsig events
Cleanup of stale Statsig configurations requires coordination with experimentation team
Blocked on Workday updates and Azure group creation for team ownership transfer
Zestification compliance requires adoption of Zest Selectable Card components
Plan switcher dropdown requires translation management through Lokalize
OTP endpoint performance (20+ second response times) impacts frontend loading state requirements
